Package hw1

Class TV

java.lang.Object
hw1.TV
public class TV
extends java.lang.Object
Model of a TV with volume and channel functions.
Author:
Matt Norton

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static double VOLUME_INCREMENT  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TV​(int givenStart, int givenChannels)
    A TV with a given starting channel and number of channels.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void channelDown()
    Changes the channel down by 1, wrapping around to start if the current channel is start + numChannales -1.
    void channelUp()
    Changes the channel up by 1, wrapping around to start if the current channel is start + numChannels -1.
    java.lang.String display()
    Returns a string representing the current channel and volume.
    int getChannel()
    Returns the current channel.
    double getVolume()
    Returns the current volume of the TV.
    void goToPreviousChannel()
    Sets the current channel to the most previous channel.
    void resetNumChannels​(int givenNumChannels)
    Resets this TV so that its available channels are now from start through start+givenNumChannels-1.
    void resetStart​(int givenStart)
    Resets this TV so that its available channels are now from givenStart through givenStart + numChannels-1.
    void setChannel​(int channelNumber)
    Sets the channel to the given number.
    void volumeDown()
    Lowers the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, but not below 0.0.
    void volumeUp()
    Raises the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, but not above 1.0.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • VOLUME_INCREMENT

      public static final double VOLUME_INCREMENT
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • TV

      public TV​(int givenStart, int givenChannels)
      A TV with a given starting channel and number of channels.
      Parameters:
      givenStart - The starting channel in the range of channels for this TV.
      givenChannels - The total number of channels available for this TV.

  • Method Details

    • volumeDown

      public void volumeDown()
      Lowers the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, but not below 0.0.

    • volumeUp

      public void volumeUp()
      Raises the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, but not above 1.0.

    • getVolume

      public double getVolume()
      Returns the current volume of the TV.
      Returns:
      Returns a double value 0.0 - 1.0 of the current volume level.

    • channelDown

      public void channelDown()
      Changes the channel down by 1, wrapping around to start if the current channel is start + numChannales -1.

    • channelUp

      public void channelUp()
      Changes the channel up by 1, wrapping around to start if the current channel is start + numChannels -1.

    • getChannel

      public int getChannel()
      Returns the current channel.
      Returns:
      Returns an integer value for the current channel.

    • setChannel

      public void setChannel​(int channelNumber)
      Sets the channel to the given number. However, if the given value is greater than start+numChannels-1, it is set to start+numChannels-1, and if the given value is less than start, it is set to start.
      Parameters:
      channelNumber - The current channel number of this TV.

    • resetNumChannels

      public void resetNumChannels​(int givenNumChannels)
      Resets this TV so that its available channels are now from start through start+givenNumChannels-1. If the current channel or previous channel is outside the new range of channel numbers, their values are adjusted to be the nearest value within the new range.
      Parameters:
      givenNumChannels - The number a channels available on this TV.

    • resetStart

      public void resetStart​(int givenStart)
      Resets this TV so that its available channels are now from givenStart through givenStart + numChannels-1. If the current channel or previous channel is outside the new range of channel numbers, their values are adjusted to be the nearest value within the new range.
      Parameters:
      givenStart - The start channel for this TV.

    • goToPreviousChannel

      public void goToPreviousChannel()
      Sets the current channel to the most previous channel. If no channel has been set for this TV using one of the methods channelDown, channelUp, or setChannel, this method sets the channel to start!

    • display

      public java.lang.String display()
      Returns a string representing the current channel and volume.
      Returns:
      A string representing the current channel and volume in the form of "Channel x Volume y%". Where x is the current channel and y is the volume multiplied by 100 and rounded to the nearest integer (0.765 -> 77%).
